Move forward to disrupt black's center pawn structure. It lets black pass a pawn, but the pawn is (so far) undefended by other pawns.
moves.16... dxc4 17. Nb5: Knight jumps to a precarious perch to threaten the bishop.
moves.17... Bb4 18. Rf1: Move to protect rook from bishop's glare.
moves.18... Na6 19. a3: Push pawn to convince bishop to move back.
moves.19... Ba5 20. Ne5: Another knight jumps to a precarious perch.
moves.20... Rac8: Black moves rook to back up the passed pawn on the c file.
moves.21... c3: Pushing a pawn makes it more dangerous - especially with the rook to back it up, but on the other hand, it exposes an unprotected black knight on a6.
moves.22. Nxe8: Black now has to choose between saving the queen and saving the knight, so black resigned.
